Reviews.Title: My first DSLR is fantastic!
Reviews.Author: Ordinary guy
Reviews.Content: Having been a big fan of Canon PowerShot cameras for a lot of years.  And dabbled in old 35mm film cameras recently.  I decided it was time to step up to a DSLR and having seen a brief piece in Consumers Reports about the Rebel SL1 I had to have one.  The camera and lenses are exactly what I wanted.  Compact, feature rich and easy to use taking great stills. I haven't tried the video capability yet.  I have a nice, small HD video camera for that which was my favorite camera til I got this little gem.The ability to chose between the camera doing all the settings work and the user choosing their settings makes this camera fun to use like my manual 35 MM's.  The huge difference being you get to see the result immediately vs. having to wait for the (now rather expensive) film to be developed.A very nice camera indeed!

Reviews.Title: Lightweight, powerful and amazing
Reviews.Author: Emerson R. de Mello
Reviews.Content: Canon SL1 is fantastic. It is small, lightweight and powerful. This set (with a TELE lens) is perfect who is starting in DSLRs world.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Patrick J. Robbins
Reviews.Content: great size/features/picture quality combination - exactly what I wanted.  I would imagine I could have spent $1000 more on a different model and really all that I would have noticed (at least for 95% of the shots we will take) is that the camera itself was bigger… not that any other features are "lost" on this SL1 just because Canon figured out how to slim it down impressively.Autofocus works quickly and the telephoto lens (55-250mm Image Stablized) is a must for anyone (even beginners) who will take pictures at any little league sporting event… the pics look great and the camera is quick enough to catch the action!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Brandon
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the price I would fully recommend this camera. Easy to use and also does great video. G

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Crystal M. Ruesch "Alaskan Gem"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It takes great pictures and it's light weight enough to make it portable. The camera gets a 5 star rating.The reason for the 4 star rating is that the zoom lens did not arrive in original Canon box and did not come with a manufacturers warranty card. It is a Canon lens and functions properly. I'm assuming it is grey market/imported.

Reviews.Title: Great compact design with full features
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my girlfriend because she was ready to step up to a full DSLR.  She didn't want a full size camera and lens to carry.  This camera is perfect.  Pictures are beautiful and the camera is easy to use.  After a couple of months, we are very happy.

Reviews.Title: Amazed
Reviews.Author: P. M.
Reviews.Content: I love the camera.  I did not think I would like the touch screen . I was so wrong. It is the best.  I can touch the screen where I want the focus and it is done.  Super!  The. Weight difference is very significant for me.  My son will inherit my XSI, which is a great camera.  I love that all my lens will work with the SL1.

Reviews.Title: Canon EOS Rebel SL1 is a great choice!!!
Reviews.Author: K. Rash "MommaShoppa"
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera.  It has amazing capabilities, and so far (I don't know that much about how to use it), but from the short time I have had it, I have learned so much!  I love how I can use autofocus and have the camera do all the work, but also have the capability to set my own aperture, etc.  I cannot wait to take outdoor pics with this, and I hope it snows this year, so I can get some pretty winter shots.

Reviews.Title: Nice Small Camera
Reviews.Author: Tim Johnson
Reviews.Content: The size is perfect for travel.  Does great in every way I need.  Only concern was that the telephoto lens was in a separate plain white box and not in the box with the camera and kit lens.  But it seems just fine.

Reviews.Title: Yay camera
Reviews.Author: Ceren Germeyan
Reviews.Content: Not that I'm any kind of authority on camera purchases but just verifying that I received exactly what I ordered in perfect condition.

Reviews.Title: MY  Inital Rebel SL 1 Impression
Reviews.Author: D. M. Dunning Sr. "SNVPeter"
Reviews.Content: As this was my first Canon, I'm impressed with the images so far.  Image stability is crucial to me as I rarely use a tripod.I also have Sony, Nikon and Olympus cameras for comparison.  I have yet to put the new SL1 to a good test but found very clear images so far.One feature I like is the touch screen.  I bought this model for my wife as it is also smallest in the line and easier for her to handle.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Donald C Hales
Reviews.Content: I'm looking forward to learning to use many of the features of the Rebel SL1.  Looks like a great camera.

Reviews.Title: DON'T DO IT!!
Reviews.Author: Albert Bowers
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera and three months after warranty it is completely useless.  To make matters worse there was nowhere near a positive response from Canon.  My first Canon, my last.  Please, save your money.

Reviews.Title: Learning Curve
Reviews.Author: Ricado Pleased
Reviews.Content: I purchased Canon on recommendation from friend due to the size, price and MP.  The MP will aid with shooting artwork and nature. Now I am going through a learning curve as my previous camera was point and shoot.
